text: Bottle shared by Benzai, 15 cl sample. Hazy golden color, medium frothy head. Aroma of funk and barnyard, slight spicy and quite some sweet herbal maltiness. Bit tart in flavor, quite some sweet apple sweetness as well. Bit unbalanced, and too high in alcohol.

Bottle @ Caesar shared with Caesar and Skortila. Slightly unclear yellow color, average sized beige head. Aroma is sourish and piss. Taste is sharply sour, unpleasantly sour imo. No, cant drink this. Bleh. Too sour.

750ml bottle in a tulip, 2 days after I dropped my cooler and the cap came loose and the beer sat in the fridge. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of typical Sante yeast/microbe goodness, some pale and sweet malts, light citrus, light oak. Flavor the same but a boozy finish. Average texture. Even Sante Adairius can be ruined by Prairie... At least Prairie got the name right.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty sour tart woody spicy yeasty citrus aroma. Fruity spicy hoppy woody yeasty citrus flavor. Has a fruity sour tart woody spicy yeasty citrus finish.
From bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is funky, crisp fruity, mild estery. LIght sour flavoured, crisp fruity, hoppy and estery. Mild sour and funky finish.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2016 Bottle, thanks rlgk! Hazy orange liquid with medium white head. Aroma of lemon, mango, light grain, pineapple, mineral, apple skin and light pear. Taste is light sweet and medium sour with notes of pineapple, mango and mineral. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Awesome!

Bottle at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Hazy golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Sourish fruity flavor, floral, hay, barnyard notes, grapes, peach, funky, some lemongrass. Tart floral flavor, grapefruit, barnyard notes, citrus, hay, funky, slightly spicy, woody, some lemongrass. Amazing beer, not your average tripel.

Nice sour and sweet balance, malty aroma and taste fruity with notes of caramel, some dried fruit, wooden oaky notes, floral hoppy, subtle citric spice into the close.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2016 Bottle shared, care of Michael. pours a hazy orange golden with small white head. Notes are sour lemon, oak, orange skin, apples, tangerine, chalky candy, and bright salty minerals. Medium body. Has some tasty Sara aspects throughout.

750 mL bottle. Hazy orange. Small white head. Smells of citrus, stone fruit, light acidity, and doughy malt. Tastes of stone fruits and a little bit of tartness. Orange lends some bitterness. Strong doughy malt. Finishes with some oak and maybe wine? Not sure. Heavy. Medium carbonation. Starts interesting, but in the end its a sweet tripel.
Bottle. Yellow pour with a white head. Sour citrus aromas. I get the orange with citrus and caramel malts. Vinegar backbeats. Good body and mouthfeel.

Bottle @ Mikes House. Thanks, Mike! Feel like the name of this beer is at least indirectly aimed at me. Nice clear golden straw colored beer with a white head and lively carbonation. Other than a bit of residual sweetness and somewhat of a canned peach note, wouldnt have pegged this as a Tripel... Pretty nice acidity and tartness, and certainly quite citrus forward. Light vanilla, some leathery funk, oak, and orange peel. Light bitterness and actually, a fair amount of fresh orange juice. Neat beer.
Bottle. Pours clear golden, small white head, decent lacing. Aroma is Bretty, hints of acetone, oak, lemon. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, some residual sweetness. Light body.

Bottle thanks to Jeremy. Pours a cloudy gold with small white head that lasts. The aroma is yeast, citrus, wood. Medium mouth, juicy citrus, light funk, oak, nice lingeing tart finish, really enjoyed this.
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Wine, oak, fruity, citrus aromas. Light fruit, citrus, oak, wine and funky Flavors.
Bottle - pours gold white head - nose and taste of wine, oak, citrus, orange peel, funk - medium body

Poured from a bottle. 
Aroma is nice with some bright grain notes and hints of caramel and candi sugar. Nice citrus note with quite a bit of orange as well as some light stone fruit. Light alcohol spice. Some oak character. 
Pours a hazy, golden orange with a small, moderately thin, white head that recedes to a thin film that lingers. Light lacing and moderate length legs. 
Flavor is somewhat sweet but finishes fairly dry. Medium light citrus and orange notes. Hints of stone fruit. Medium oak notes and hints of alcohol. Some light floral esters. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice beer but kinda odd. Lots of orange and oak. Meh.

Hazy heavy glowing honey pour with light head. Nose is vanilla and orange peel bad. Some paint thinner and barrel character. Heavy body with strong alcohol. Taste is quite nice under the heavy alcohol. Orange peel, paint thinner, floral notes with strong honey. Nice beer, but a little strong booze for my taste.
Pours light orange with an off white head. Bretty orange soda with a white wine end. Flavor is basically an oaky bretty mimosa. Nice even tartness, maybe a little acetic.
